00042     // Match a sequence of characters delimited by the supplied chars.
00043     template <char beg, char end, bool esc>
00044     const char* delimited_by(const char* src) {
00045       src = exactly<beg>(src);
00046       if (!src) return 0;
00047       const char* stop;
00048       while (1) {
00049         if (!*src) return 0;
00050         stop = exactly<end>(src);
00051         if (stop && (!esc || *(src - 1) != '\\')) return stop;
00052         src = stop ? stop : src + 1;
00053       }
00054     }
00055 
00056     // skip to delimiter (mx) inside given range
00057     // this will savely skip over all quoted strings
00058     // recursive skip stuff delimited by start/stop
00059     // first start/opener must be consumed already!
00060     template<prelexer start, prelexer stop>
00061     const char* skip_over_scopes(const char* src, const char* end) {
00062 
00063       size_t level = 0;
00064       bool in_squote = false;
00065       bool in_dquote = false;
00066       // bool in_braces = false;
00067 
00068       while (*src) {
00069 
00070         // check for abort condition
00071         if (end && src >= end) break;
00072 
00073         // has escaped sequence?
00074         if (*src == '\\') {
00075           ++ src; // skip this (and next)
00076         }
00077         else if (*src == '"') {
00078           in_dquote = ! in_dquote;
00079         }
00080         else if (*src == '\'') {
00081           in_squote = ! in_squote;
00082         }
00083         else if (in_dquote || in_squote) {
00084           // take everything literally
00085         }
00086 
00087         // find another opener inside?
00088         else if (const char* pos = start(src)) {
00089           ++ level; // increase counter
00090           src = pos - 1; // advance position
00091         }
00092 
00093         // look for the closer (maybe final, maybe not)
00094         else if (const char* final = stop(src)) {
00095           // only close one level?
00096           if (level > 0) -- level;
00097           // return position at end of stop
00098           // delimiter may be multiple chars
00099           else return final;
00100           // advance position
00101           src = final - 1;
00102         }
00103 
00104         // next
00105         ++ src;
00106       }
00107 
00108       return 0;
00109     }
00110 
00111     // skip to a skip delimited by parentheses
00112     // uses smart `skip_over_scopes` internally
00113     const char* parenthese_scope(const char* src);
00114 
00115     // skip to delimiter (mx) inside given range
00116     // this will savely skip over all quoted strings
00117     // recursive skip stuff delimited by start/stop
00118     // first start/opener must be consumed already!
00119     template<prelexer start, prelexer stop>
00120     const char* skip_over_scopes(const char* src) {
00121       return skip_over_scopes<start, stop>(src, 0);
00122     }
00123 
00124     // Match a sequence of characters delimited by the supplied chars.
00125     template <prelexer start, prelexer stop>
00126     const char* recursive_scopes(const char* src) {
00127       // parse opener
00128       src = start(src);
00129       // abort if not found
00130       if (!src) return 0;
00131       // parse the rest until final closer
00132       return skip_over_scopes<start, stop>(src);
00133     }
00134 
00135     // Match a sequence of characters delimited by the supplied strings.
00136     template <const char* beg, const char* end, bool esc>
00137     const char* delimited_by(const char* src) {
00138       src = exactly<beg>(src);
00139       if (!src) return 0;
00140       const char* stop;
00141       while (1) {
00142         if (!*src) return 0;
00143         stop = exactly<end>(src);
00144         if (stop && (!esc || *(src - 1) != '\\')) return stop;
00145         src = stop ? stop : src + 1;
00146       }
00147     }
00148 
00149     // Tries to match a certain number of times (between the supplied interval).
00150     template<prelexer mx, size_t lo, size_t hi>
00151     const char* between(const char* src) {
00152       for (size_t i = 0; i < lo; ++i) {
00153         src = mx(src);
00154         if (!src) return 0;
00155       }
00156       for (size_t i = lo; i <= hi; ++i) {
00157         const char* new_src = mx(src);
00158         if (!new_src) return src;
00159         src = new_src;
00160       }
00161       return src;
00162     }

00330     // Utility functions for finding and counting characters in a string.
00331     template<char c>
00332     const char* find_first(const char* src) {
00333       while (*src && *src != c) ++src;
00334       return *src ? src : 0;
00335     }
00336     template<prelexer mx>
00337     const char* find_first(const char* src) {
00338       while (*src && !mx(src)) ++src;
00339       return *src ? src : 0;
00340     }
00341     template<prelexer mx>
00342     const char* find_first_in_interval(const char* beg, const char* end) {
00343       bool esc = false;
00344       while ((beg < end) && *beg) {
00345         if (esc) esc = false;
00346         else if (*beg == '\\') esc = true;
00347         else if (mx(beg)) return beg;
00348         ++beg;
00349       }
00350       return 0;
00351     }
00352     template <prelexer mx>
00353     unsigned int count_interval(const char* beg, const char* end) {
00354       unsigned int counter = 0;
00355       bool esc = false;
00356       while (beg < end && *beg) {
00357         const char* p;
00358         if (esc) {
00359           esc = false;
00360           ++beg;
00361         } else if (*beg == '\\') {
00362           esc = true;
00363           ++beg;
00364         } else if ((p = mx(beg))) {
00365           ++counter;
00366           beg = p;
00367         }
00368         else {
00369           ++beg;
00370         }
00371       }
00372       return counter;
00373     }
